channel.title: mbAInewsletter
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from mbAInewsletter, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Mortgage rates tumble to lowest level since October 2024
item.description: The average rate on the 30-year fixed mortgage fell this week to 6.5%, according to the latest Freddie Mac data released on Thursday. That is down fro...

item.title: Authorities raided Streameast’s offices and shut down the largest illegal sports streaming platform that had over 1.6 billion visits in the last year
item.description: The network illegally streamed matches and games from Europe’s Premier League and Champions League, as well as those from the NFL, NBA, and MLB.

item.title: What's Going On With Amazon Stock Thursday?
item.description: Amazon shares are trading higher Thursday afternoon. The company announced a deal with JetBlue Airways. read more

item.title: Deal or No Deal? Has Trump Driven Stake Through Heart of ‘Green New Scam’?
item.description: Is the Green New Deal dead or not? On the campaign trail, President Donald Trump repeatedly vowed to repeal what he called the “green new... Read More...

item.title: Meet TOT: The US Equity ETF That Won't Pay You Dividends, On Purpose
item.description: LionShares has a new U.S. equity ETF designed to tackle tax drag by rethinking dividends with a more efficient path to long-term growth. read more

item.title: If you bought a gold bar at Costco last year, here is what it's worth now
item.description: Gold hit a record $3,578 per ounce before declining Thursday, driven by weak jobs data and investor concerns about tariffs and Federal Reserve policy ...

item.title: The Lewis-Tolkien Biography… For People Who Don’t Want to Read a Lewis-Tolkien Biography
item.description: John Hendrix’s magically illustrated biography tells the tale of one of literature’s greatest friendships. Show, don’t tell, say the masters of litera...

item.title: The US will buy 2 million doses of an HIV prevention drug for low-income countries
item.description: The U.S. is purchasing enough doses of a new twice-a-year HIV prevention shot to share with up to 2 million people in poor countries by 2028

item.title: T. Rowe Price shares jump after deal where Goldman will invest $1 billion in asset manager
item.description: Goldman will buy up to $1 billion in T. Rowe Price common stock through open market purchases with the intention to own up to 3.5%.

item.title: Sweetgreen CFO Mitch Reback to retire; Jamie McConnell named successor
Trump Administration To Ease Safety Mandates For Automated Vehicles As Tesla, Waymo Seek to Expand Robotaxi Operations
item.description: The NHTSA stated that current vehicle safety standards, written decades ago, fail to account for automated vehicles.

item.title: Ray Dalio Warns Fed Rate Cut In September Could Trigger Stagflation Risk
item.description: The billionaire investor predicts a weaker dollar, a steeper yield curve, and stocks doing relatively poorly despite the easing.

item.title: Trump-Illinois Staredown Intensifies As State Denies Voter Data Request
item.description: Illinois state officials told the Department of Justice they won’t be turning over voter data, despite the Trump administration’s request. In a letter...

item.title: Labor market growth slows dramatically in August with U.S. adding just 54,000 jobs, ADP says
item.description: U.S. private-sector hiring rose less than expected in August, according to ADP.

item.title: Trump signs Japan trade pact, capping tariffs at 15%
